sub_title: Deep-Tech Product & Market Strategy l MBA Entrepreneurship | MSc. Quantum Physics
summary:
A versatile physicist and engineer who has built complex experimental setups, performed measurements and data analysis to understand the physical implications of measured quantities, been involved in stakeholder management and solved major customer escalations by being the technical lead. 

A passionate and ambitious person who is seeking a technical leadership opportunity  in the realm of high-tech development, production processes and complex equipment solutions. In order to advance in this role, I have pursued online courses on lean production and six-sigma quality management. 

Being a very people oriented person, I would  like to work with self-driven engineers having complementary skills and trying to find solutions to challenging problems in an organised environment. Thus, engaging in cordial, fruitful scientific discussions with colleagues and learning from each other.

My personal interests are: Fitness (Powerlifting, Running, Yoga, Climbing, Cycling, Hiking) , travelling and exploring across different landscapes and cultures , amateur photography (cover picture: sunset at the cliffs of Malta captured by me).

This fellowship is awarded to only 10 people, and was awarded to only 1 non-UK candidate.

awards.title: EMINTE Full Scholarship (Tuition+Stipend)
awards.description: Received EMINTE (Erasmus Mundus India to Europe) full scholarship (tuition+stipend) for pursuing master studies at University of Amsterdam. It is awarded on a highly competitive basis to approx. 5 people based on academic performance, research experience, co-curricular activities, recommendation letters.
awards.issuer: Erasmus Mundus and Lund University, Sweden

awards.title: JN Tata Endowment
awards.description: Received  JN Tata Endowment, a prestigious scholarship, setup by Jamshedji Tata in 1892 for pursuing higher education in some of the best universities in the world. It is awarded on a highly competitive basis, based on academic performance, research experience, co-curricular activities, recommendation letters. After that personal interviews are held to judge the candidate's achievements, future plans, leadership qualities.

awards.title: INSPIRE Scholarship
awards.description: Scholarship by the Department of Science and Technology, India for being in the top 1% of AISSCE examination for pursuing bachelor studies in Physics. This examination is a nation-wide test for majority of high school students in India who prepare to get admitted in university for higher education.
awards.issuer: Department of Science and Technology, India

profile_positions.title: Application Engineer and Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
--I was part of a 9- month acceleration program for building deep tech startups from scratch. The idea was a Philips patented technology, which is to measure the volume of the human bladder using an ultrasound patch on your abdomen.
--We built a team of 10 members in an online fast hackathon and I was one of the co-founding members.
--My role as the head of technology included: Drafting a detailed technology/product roadmap for scaling the technology from a demonstrator (TRL3) to a patch on the abdomen (TRL8).
--Seek and pitch for collaborative development partners, potential loans, subsidies, venture capital investments .
--Perform market research to find the best form fit market for the technology.
--Think of innovative and creative ways of team building.
--Perform talent recruitment for expansion of technology team.

profile_positions.title: Physics Research and Development Engineer and Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Working in the DUV Projection lens group via TMC Physics. The group is part of the optical column of the nano-lithography machines manufactured at ASML. The projection lens is designed by us and manufactured at our supplier Carl Zeiss Optics (CZO). The lens is responsible for focusing light at nano-metre precision on the wafer for printing desired structures for our customers in the semiconductor industry.  

--Working in a scrum/agile team of 8 development members and 1 product owner, who are responsible for designing new  nanolithography machines and sustaining them in the factory or customer site.

--Using analytical, leadership, communication, negotiation skills with other departments/ stakeholders/ marketing to solve  escalations and design new upgrades and products, define specifications of products, for customers like Intel, Samsung, TSMC.

--Developing, and sustaining  tooling in MATLAB,  and performing data analysis, data visualization, data science and problem solving with it.
profile_positions.title: Optical Design Engineer

profile_positions.description:
My research tasks both independently and in collaboration with two post doctorates at the Laboratory for Quantum Magnetism  involved:

--measurement of AC susceptibility of LiErF4 at ultra-low temperatures using a dilution refrigerator, for studying the magnetic properties of LiErF4 and observing Quantum Phase Transitions (QPTs). 
      --This involves operating, handling and assembling the dilution refrigerator, 
      --operating and handling low-temperature sensors and temperature controllers,
      --sample preparation, includes cutting crystals and moulding them,
      --interfacing the dilution refrigerator, temperature controllers, current controllers and lock-in amplifiers with software written in LabVIEW, 
      --performing measurement series by writing scripts in the data acquisition software, 
      --writing instrument operation manuals and detailed log book of experimental runs, 
      --handling liquid helium and nitrogen, 
      --handling vacuum systems and maintaining turbo pumps,
      --performing data analysis using MATLAB and speculating physical interpretation of experimental data,
      --developing a theoretical model using mean-field theory, and executing simulations in MATLAB,
      --compare and contrast experiments and theory,
      --writing an article in a peer-reviewed journal.
      --providing technical assistance to  collaborators for performing their experiment using the dilution refrigerator.

Courses pursued:
--Solid State Physics X: Advanced experimental techniques.
--Waveguides and Fibre Lasers.
--Advanced experimental methods in condensed matter and nanophysics, MPI, Stuttgart.
--Labview Core 1,2,3 and Labview DAQ by National Instruments.
--French, Beginner Course, A1

Poster Presentation:
--28th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics, Gothenburg, Sweden.
--Physics Day, EPFL.

Teaching Assistant:
--Electromagnetism for Civil Engineers.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Project Title: Rebuilding a potassium quantum gas apparatus. 
--The project was not funded and most of the research was performed independently by me.

--During my thesis, I re-built the laser system required for a magneto-optical trap (MOT), where potassium atoms are cooled and trapped with the help of lasers and magnetic fields.

--The experimental setup consists of various building blocks.
        --First, the computer control system for controlling the whole experiment using C++, which includes radio-frequency generation for operating the acousto-optic modulators (AOMs); 
        --Second, the master laser, an external cavity diode laser (ECDL), which helps us to precisely tune the wavelength of the laser beam in the nano-metre range; 
        --Third, the laser lock spectroscopy setup for stabilizing the laser frequency on a particular atomic transition; 
        --Fourth, optical setup for amplifying the laser power using tapered amplifiers and shifting its frequency with the help of multiple AOMs for trapping the atoms; 
         --Fifth, the magneto-optical trap (MOT) setup, consisting of various vacuum chambers and magnets, to which the light is transported via optical fibres from the optical setup.
         --Sixth, fluorescence and absorption imaging setups for imaging the trapped atoms.
         --Finally, it involved theoretical simulations and developing a multi-level atomic system model using MATHEMATICA to compare the experimentally obtained laser lock spectroscopy signal. And an excellent agreement with the experimental data was obtained.

Oral Presentation:
--At AMOLF, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
--At Amsterdam Master Symposium, Vrije Universiteit (VU), Amsterdam, The Netherlands (Only 5 students were selected).
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Project

profile_positions.description:
Project Title: Deposition of size selected copper nanoclusters on HOPG (graphite) and study of its morphological properties by characterization techniques.

It involved carrying out experiments with nanocluster deposition system and characterizing them with techniques like X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS) and Atomic-Force Microscopy (AFM).
